;Since the Jiajing period, the Ming Dynasty has suffered from internal and external troubles and numerous crises. Some people attribute it to Yangming's philosophy of "talking about harming the country". After the Ding Revolution, the survivors of the Ming Dynasty learned from the pain, reflected on the historical lessons of the country's subjugation, and believed that "Wang Xue" was one of the culprits. The most representative figure among them is Gu Yanwu. In his article "The Master's Words and the Way of Heaven", He denounced Wang Xue's "empty words of understanding one's mind and one's nature, replacing the practical knowledge of cultivating oneself and governing others", which resulted in "the collapse of the Chinese state and the ruins of clans and societies!" Famous Confucian scholars such as Zhang Luxiang, Lu Longqi, Lu Shiyi, and Xiong Cilu all expressed this opinion. , and advocated the revitalization of Cheng-Zhu Neo-Confucianism and the application of practical knowledge to correct the shortcomings of Wang Xue.

;

;Qian Chengzhi, a survivor of the Ming Dynasty, said unceremoniously in a letter to Gu Yanwu's nephew Xu Yuanwen that Gu Yanwu's denigration of Yangming's studies was just a remnant of the spit of an old student in Wujiang, and had no factual basis. , very emotional. Some modern scholars have expressed doubts about Gu's statement. The author believes that the "Wang Xue theory of subjugation of the country" is divorced from the facts and is the product of the party struggle at that time.

;

;;

;

;The statue of Gu Yan is in the collection of the National Museum.

;

;First of all, theoretically speaking, Yangming's philosophy of mind is not a study of mysterious emptiness and emptiness as Gu and others said, but a study of practical application of the world. In his "Reply to Gu Dongqiao", Yangming criticized "those stubborn, empty and quiet people" who "cannot govern the country and the world", and advocated "practicing one's work" and integrating knowledge and action. He publicly declared that he disdained the study of exegesis, memorization, and verses. He said that practicing verses was "as if he were on the stage of a hundred plays." It's shameful." Wang Yangming had the ambition to help the world since he was a child. He studied riding and archery, and studied the art of war. He once went deep outside the Great Wall to inspect geography. The most outstanding sign of his integration of knowledge and action was the application of the art of mind to military practice. According to his disciple Wang Ji's "Yu Yu" Recalling the article "Xu Jiang": When I asked my former master what was the secret behind the saying that he was like a god in using troops, the master said: "I have no secret skills, but I have always believed in conscience. Whenever I take advantage of the opportunity to face the enemy, I only have this little bit of spiritual intelligence and spiritual response." , I am not moved by the interests of life and death, so my plans are carefully planned, and the enemy does not know where he is coming. I am originally a person who practices my duty, but the world mistakenly thinks that I am a god." Volume 4 of He Liangjun's "Siyou Zhaicong Shuo" concludes : Wang Yangming said, "The military is based on lectures and tactics are used, and the administration is based on lectures and political skills." The mutual complementation of academics and achievements enabled Yangming to achieve great success in the military. During the Jiajing period, in response to the imperial court's outright rejection of Yangming's scholarship, Huang Wan pointed out that the essence of Yangming's scholarship was "to consider what people say and do, and not to just talk in vain."

;

;Secondly, from a practical point of view, many disciples of the Wang Sect and their followers have made achievements that will be remembered by future generations. Yangming did not regard knowledge as the only criterion for accepting disciples. Among his disciples were potters, farmers, woodcutter, etc. There were knights who "fighted dragons and snakes with bare hands", counselors who made plans, and generals who led troops in war. For example, Hu Zongxian, a disciple of Ouyang De, led the army and people of Zhejiang to fight against Japanese invaders, and planned to capture and kill the great Japanese pirates Wang Zhi and Xu Hai to quell the Japanese invaders in Zhejiang and Zhejiang. Weng Wanda, governor of Shaanxi and governor of Xuanda, was one of the coffin bearers when Wang Yangming was buried. He was friendly with Yangming's disciples Ouyang De, Luo Hongxian, Tang Shunzhi, Wang Ji and others. Weng Wanda was in charge of the northern border defense for five or six years, and made outstanding achievements in fighting against the invasion of Mongolia. Guo Zizhang, a disciple of Ouyang De, patrolled Guizhou in the 26th year of Wanli (1598). He worked with Li Hualong to suppress Yang Yinglong's rebellion in Bozhou and was known as the first famous official in central Guizhou. Luo Rufang, a student of Yan Jun, was criticized by people in the early Qing Dynasty for "talking about nothing". In fact, he visited many places to study and inspect society in his early years. In the early years of Wanli, the imperial court adopted a policy of appeasement against the expansion and aggression of the Burmese king. According to the "Bureau", Luo Rufang, who was then the right political participant in Yunnan, planned to encircle the Mang clan of the Burmese king. However, his success fell short because someone slandered the governor Wang Ning. Luo Rufang " He threw himself to the ground in anger and cursed loudly." This caused serious trouble, and the Burmese army invaded Yunnan in a large scale. Li Cai, who had studied under Zou Shouyi, wiped out pirates and Japanese pirates when he was in Guangdong; when he was in Yunnan, he defeated the Burmese invasion. Luo Hongxian, the number one scholar of the Private Shu Wang Yangming, is described in the original "History of the Ming Dynasty" as "leaping his horse and drawing his bow, examining the history through research". The rivers and canals, frontier fortresses, battle formations, offenses and defenses, etc. are not studied in detail. Shunzhi of Tang Dynasty in Huiyuan Dynasty, who "heard the words of conscience from Wang Ji", is said in the "History of Ming Dynasty" to "know everything about learning" and pay special attention to practical learning. He "never forgot the world and the country in his heart", and until his deathbed, he still thought about the safety of the country and did not care about his private affairs. In the thirty-sixth year of Jiajing's reign (1557), Zhao Wenhua, a member of Yan Song's party, supervised the military affairs of Jiangsu and Zhejiang and recommended him as the chief of the Nanjing Ministry of War. Shun Zhi put the country first, regardless of the tarnished reputation, and resolutely came out of the mountain. He inspected Jizhen, verified the number of troops, and put forward many practical suggestions. He also assisted Hu Zongxian in fighting against Japanese invaders, patrolled the sea to inspect the situation of bandits, formulated strategies to attack, intercept and block the enemy, and personally commanded and won great victories such as Yaojiadang. The famous anti-Japanese generals Tan Lun, Yu Dayou, Qi Jiguang, Liu Xian, etc. were all appreciated and promoted by him. In addition, Yan Jun, Xu Wei, disciples of the Wang family, and Zheng Ruozeng, who was influenced by Yangming's psychology, all served in the Hu Zongxian shogunate and made their own contributions to the pacification of Japan in different ways.

;

;Many military generals with great military exploits are also disciples of the Wang Clan. For example, Governor Wanbiao got his philosophical ideas from Wang Ji, Luo Hongxian, Qian Dehong and Tang Shunzhi. He once personally led the monk soldiers to fight against the Japanese pirates at Yangjing Bridge in Suzhou, and was hit by an arrow without leaving the line of fire. Yu Dayou followed Yangming's Xinxue in his early years and later studied under Tang Shunzhi. Qi Jiguang was also "a private person of Shu Yangming and a great expounder of conscience". He once entered Qian Dehong's family, and Qian Dehong recommended him to Hu Zongxian. Qi Jiguang advocated taking "sincerity" as the work force, "practicing it personally", and focusing on "treating the mind" in military training. Deng Zilong learned from Luo Hong before he became an official, and he kept it in mind throughout his life. He fought in all directions and made many meritorious deeds. Later, in the war to aid Korea, even though he was nearly seventy years old, he fought bravely to kill the enemy and sacrificed his life for the country.

;

;It can be seen from this that since the Ming Dynasty, everyone in the Wang family has been a person of great achievements. On the other hand, among the Donglin Party members, except for loyal and honest ministers, there are very few capable ministers in the world.

;

;Faced with the grim reality of "the sky collapsed and the earth collapsed" in the late Ming Dynasty, the Donglin Party members mistakenly blamed Wang Xue and believed that Zhu Zixue was the panacea to save the world. They criticize the corrupt Confucians for being "ignorant of affairs and current affairs. They harm one person, harm the whole family, harm one country, and harm the whole world." ("Chronicles of Donglin Academy· Donglin Theory of Learning") This is precisely the self-portrait of the Donglin Party members. The Taizhou School founded by Wang Gen, a disciple of Yangming, has long pointed out that "human relations physics" and "common people's daily needs" are Tao, and the disciples of Cheng and Zhu are the corrupt Confucians who "do not understand affairs and are not familiar with current affairs." In the second year of Duanping in the Southern Song Dynasty (1234), the Neo-Confucian master Zhen Dexiu paid homage to Zhen Dexiu to consult on political affairs. People had high expectations for him, thinking that he could establish peace. However, after Zhen Dexiu took office, Prime Minister Zheng Qingzhi did nothing and could not save the declining Southern Song Dynasty. Therefore, the Yuan people's cancellation of the imperial examination for a time had something to do with the empty talk of Song Confucianism that harmed the country. Song Lian, the leader of civil servants in the early Ming Dynasty, advocated the use of Confucianism, but he had to admit in the "Biography of Wu Deji" that Song Confucianism could not do much more in promoting Confucianism, but in the end he did not make much difference to the world. By the middle of the Ming Dynasty, Cheng-Zhu Neo-Confucianism was on the verge of "dying to death" because the late Neo-Confucianists "only discussed it in footnotes". In "Remembering the Past", Li Zhi mocked the pedantic Confucians who "have nothing to do in daily life, only do bows and bows, sit on the ground all day long, like clay sculptures and think that they cannot afford distracting thoughts, then they are the real great sages and great sages." And "when there is a police officer, they look at each other with no color, and even blame each other, thinking they can be wise." In "The Biography of Mr. Yangming, the Confucian Prince of the Ming Dynasty", the scholar Shen Shixing sharply criticized those who attacked Wang Yangming: "Most of the Confucian officials in modern times take it for granted that they are well-dressed and well-dressed, but when it comes to their daily use, they often suffer from rigidity and nothing." To make achievements; to study extensively and listen in order to learn, but to find out the actual results, they are often obsessed with what they have seen and heard without experiencing, and the customs have been immersed in them for a long time!" This kind of person may be morally impeccable, but he is mediocre and incompetent, and only knows how to die in literature. Advice, fight to the death. Donglin Party members equate morality with ability, and due to the limitations of the times, it is difficult to give a fair definition of "morality". In the face of foreign aggression, they do not know how to adapt and are immoral. Zhang Luxiang's "Yuan Xue Ji" says that "Yangming used troops mostly to win by deceit, which Confucians would not do." University scholar Wang Xijue pointedly pointed out: Zou Yuanbiao, the highly respected moral benchmark in Donglin, is just a "student with simple wishes and no other extraordinary ideas." There is a shortage of talents in the temple, and there is an urgent need to break down barriers and recruit talents in any way. Zhang Juzheng had long been dissatisfied with the "conventional and vulgar Confucianism" and called for "heroic and true Confucianism". Jiang Yingke said in "Ancient Theory on Employment": "To achieve great things, do not pay attention to details; to achieve great achievements, do not pay attention to small righteousness." Some people even want to select talents from the grassland. Li Zhi especially praised the pirate Lin Daoqian, Zhong In "Preface to Water Margin", Xing also lamented that "there are no Li Kui or Wu Yong in the world" and "every time I recite the autumn wind, I think of the warriors and shout madly for them."

;

;In addition to corrupt Confucianism, pseudo-Taoism is more harmful. Li Zhi had long criticized the pseudo-Confucianism in "The Theory of the Return of Three Religions to Confucianism" that "yang represents Taoism, yin represents wealth and honor, being subdued by elegance, and behaving like a dog and a pig." The Donglin Party members adhered to their sectarian views. After taking control of the election, "anyone who disobeys Donglin will be accused of being traitorous." Later, the society was restored to "hijack the government and control the government from afar." On the occasion of the change of dynasty, many Donglin Party members "changed their rules and changed their ways", which was surprising. Therefore, Li Zhi said long ago in "Party Stele": Secular people "only know that villains can harm the country, but they don't know that gentlemen can harm the country." Wei Xi's "On the Song Dynasty" also said: "The disasters of the country are not caused by villains, but by gentlemen." They are members of the same party and oppose differences. They do not pursue selfish interests, are interested in fame and profit, and do not hesitate to kill themselves to gain fame. This is what Zhang Tingyu said in "Cheng Huai" It is said in "Yuan Yu" that "killing the remains of parents will lead to the tyranny of the country, loyalty and filial piety, and both will be damaged." Therefore, some knowledgeable people in the early Qing Dynasty believed that the Ming Dynasty did not fall to rogue bandits, but to Donglin.

;

;In addition to partisan factors, "The Theory of Wang Xue Misleading the Country" also has a strong regional flavor. In the Ming Dynasty, the Donglin Party and the Zhejiang Party were at odds with each other. Later, the Zhejiang Party relied on the Eunuch Party, and they even fought to the death. In academic terms, Cheng-Zhu Neo-Confucianism and Lu Wang Xinxue were also on the same page. From the late Ming Dynasty to the Qing Dynasty, those who sympathized with the Donglin Party People have the right to speak, and the mainstream ideology is Cheng-Zhu Neo-Confucianism. During the Daoguang period, Liang Shaoren, a native of Qiantang, expressed strong dissatisfaction with this in his "Essays on Two Kinds of Autumn Rains". He believed that "Wang Wencheng's achievements are shining brightly, and he is the best of his generation. He only reveals the world with his conscience, which is a little tired of his cleverness, and the debaters are extremely intent on slandering him. How can we say that the world with Ming will not perish by bandits but perish by Yang Ming!" He sighed with emotion: "Today the world is all followers of Zi Yang, no wonder thousands of people gathered together to point it out!" According to Liang Qichao's "The Recent Three Years of China" According to "A Hundred Years of Academic History", in the early Qing Dynasty, even righteous men such as Huang Daozhou, Zhang Huangyan, Wang Yi, Qu Shishu, Chen Zizhuang, Zhang Jiayu, etc. who insisted on resisting the Qing Dynasty and restoring the Ming Dynasty did not dare to consider themselves to have "come from the arms of the mother of the Yangming School" "Nurture them out", but their motivation to resist the Qing Dynasty actually came from the Yangming School. It can be seen that Cheng and Zhu were powerful in the Qing Dynasty.

;Who is Chizuru Ueno? Searching for the topic of the same name on Weibo, there are 100 million views.

;

;In February 2023, three female bloggers who graduated from Peking University had an online conversation with Chizuru Ueno, and the resulting controversy put the latter's name at the top of the hot search list. So far, the entries for this conversation have been read 580 million times on the Weibo platform alone, and the topic about Chizuru Ueno has "broken the circle."

;

;This was launched in 2019. Prior to this, very few of Chizuru Ueno's books were published in mainland China, and most of them were circulated in the sociology circle. In 2019, Chizuru Ueno spoke at the opening ceremony of the University of Tokyo. After the video circulated on the Internet, she also gained great popularity in China.

;

;;

;

;Chizuru Ueno, born in 1948 in Toyama Prefecture, Japan, is a Japanese sociologist and a pioneer in the fields of Japanese women's studies and gender studies. She is currently an honorary professor at the University of Tokyo. ;(Information picture/picture);

;

;In her speech, she focused on the two incidents of Tokyo Medical University entrance examination fraud and Tokyo University sexual assault. , questioned the widespread gender discrimination in Japanese society, and then pointed out through data that the ratio of male and female students at the University of Tokyo is uneven, but the reason is not that female students are not as good as male students, but that "there are various wrong social concepts and unfair admissions in entrance examinations" question". Ueno warned the freshmen: "What awaits you in the future will be a society where no matter how hard you work, you may not get a fair reward..."

;

;Chizuru Ueno was introduced to China in 2015 after a speech at the University of Tokyo sparked discussion. Zi's ​​old work "Misogyny" was quickly reprinted more than twenty times, becoming an important publishing phenomenon in recent years. Since then, other works by Chizuru Ueno have been introduced and published.

;

;;

;

;Chizuru Ueno spoke at the opening ceremony of the University of Tokyo in 2019. ;(Information picture/picture);

;

;One of the influences of the book "Misogyny" is that "Misogyny" ) such an academic term has been successfully transformed into popular vocabulary. Ueno believes that men often show contempt for women, while women show self-loathing: "If I am 100% not misogynistic, there is no need to be a feminist, because I no longer need to fight. Feminism means constant People who struggle with inner misogyny."

;

;Since then, netizens have often habitually incorporated it into their own life situations to explain the underlying causes of many unpleasant events in life, such as secretly filming women Private photos are uploaded online, gender discrimination in the workplace, product advertising creates body anxiety, celebrities "cheat"...

;

;Publisher Chen Xiying published a collection of conversations between Chizuru Ueno and manga artist Nagako Tamafusa in 2021 "From "Feminism from Scratch" has actual sales of more than 200,000 copies and continues to be printed. In Chen Xiying’s impression, after the word feminism entered China, everyone was still relatively unfamiliar with its connotation and denotation. However, "Feminism from Scratch" is a popular work that integrates daily life into Examples are readily available.

;

;The dialogue in the book basically revolves around women's "parental shortcomings", from the length of the skirts of female students' school uniforms to the fact that women are often accused of "revealing clothing" in sexual harassment cases; from the plots of popular TV series to the dilemma of female childbearing; even when talking about the media's shaping of teenagers, it makes readers realize that the setting of Shizuka in "Doraemon" both attracting men and rebuking men is also a kind of "misogyny".

;

;The Chinese publishing industry published seven Ueno books in 2022, including the best-selling book "Starting at the Limit". Since 2023, Ueno has published more than ten books in China, including serious academic works, as well as relatively light popular readings and dialogue collections. The content covers Chizuru Ueno's areas of concern in the past forty years. For example, "Women's Thoughts", which combs the ideological context of Japanese women's studies, "Unpaid Housewives", which cares about the "unpaid" work of housewives, and "A Man's Old Queen", which focuses on the issue of elderly care...

;

;In Beijing In an Internet celebrity bookstore that mainly sells best-selling books, Southern Weekend reporters saw that the most conspicuous place at the entrance was Chizuru Ueno's "Women's Thoughts", "Feminism from Scratch", "Misogyny" and "For Survival". "Thoughts" and other works are placed together with popular and practical books such as "How to Deal with Divorce" and "Common Knowledge of Civil Code in Marriage and Love".

;

;;

;

;Chizuru Ueno's teachings have great influence in Chinese academic circles and the public sphere. Lu Weiwei, a professor at Southeast University who had invited Chizuru Ueno as a visiting scholar, was influenced by her and established a gender research group at the school. The most subscribed female podcast program "Random Fluctuation" on the Xiaoyu App started talking about Chizuru Ueno in the first episode. The picture shows a woman reading a book in the EMI Building in Xujiahui Park, Shanghai, in April 2023. ;(Visual China/Photo);

;

;One of the focuses of the dispute between the three female bloggers mentioned above and Ueno is that the blogger who is married and has children The Lord asked Ueno, who chose not to get married and have children, "Did you decide not to get married because you were hurt by men?" This type of question is not uncommon in life. It is a misunderstanding that many people have about single women, so it has offended many people on the Internet. Netizens spontaneously posted in defense of Chizuru Ueno, believing that the three bloggers did not understand what feminism was and that such questions were very "misogynistic".

;

;I like communicating with people from the bottom of my heart

;

;On social platforms, Chizuru Ueno shows off her iconic red hair. She speaks softly and smiles, but her remarks are sharp. For example, she once strongly criticized the gender injustice in Japanese society, exposing the reality of how women are coerced by "maternal love" and extracting "surplus value", and said: "Shout when it hurts" Pain, human dignity begins here.”

;

;“I got to know Chizuru Ueno through Professor Toyo Suga of the University of Tokyo. Suga is a famous Japanese folklorist. He told me that Ueno plays an important role in the whole of Japan. Her influence in the field of humanities and social sciences ranks among the top five, so I must read more of her works." Lu Weiwei, a professor at the School of Foreign Languages ​​at Southeast University, told Southern Weekend reporters. As one of Ueno's earliest researchers and translators in China, Lu Weiwei was originally engaged in folklore research. In recent years, she has also taken gender studies as her main research direction.

;

;Lu Weiwei has systematically read more than 30 works by Chizuru Ueno. She concluded: "Ueno and his peers established Japanese women's studies, and things that were not included in academic vision in the past began to be taken seriously. Research, she identified such an academic field."

;

;After retiring from the University of Tokyo, Chizuru Ueno has been very active, and her research has gradually shifted to issues such as elderly care and care. Lu Weiwei recalled: "When I visited Teacher Ueno in Tokyo in July 2023, she also gave me three new books. She is 75 years old and is still actively working and writing."

;

;In 2018, Lu Weiwei planned The "Todai × Todai" (abbreviations for the University of Tokyo and Southeast University respectively) series of lectures invites Ueno to give lectures at Southeast University in 2019. Classes run from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. every day, and Ueno often takes the initiative to ask for extra classes. From gender studies to aging studies, Chizuru Ueno "teaches everything" in almost all fields of her research.

;

;After finishing the course at Southeast University, Lu Weiwei accompanied Ueno to visit several cities such as Xi'an, Harbin, Changchun and Beijing, and gave sharings at different universities. After 18 days of contact, Lu Weiwei got a deeper understanding of Ueno: "She is very curious and very considerate. I praised the umbrella she brought with her for its practicality and beauty, and she gave it to me before leaving."

;

;Media person Qing Qingzi planned and published a collection of dialogues between female scholars, which included her in-depth interview with Chizuru Ueno in 2021. During the exchange, Ueno not only expressed her own opinions, but also listened carefully and listened carefully to the interview. The situation in China is of great interest. Since the video interview was very long, Chizuru Ueno even ordered a cake and said, "If we meet, we can eat it together."

;

;Qingqingzi felt that Ueno was a very candid scholar. Although she said that she did not want to expose her personal side, she was still very willing to expose herself when the conversation was enjoyable. After getting to know each other through interviews, Qingqingzi and Ueno maintained email communication like friends. "Ueno really likes to communicate with people from the bottom of his heart."

;

;In February 2023, just a few days after Chizuru Ueno’s discussion about being single and getting married became a hot search topic on Weibo, the Japanese media “Shukan Bunshun” published an article titled “Chizuru Ueno, the founder of single education, naturalizes” The article "Marriage" broke the news that Chizuru Ueno and the late historian Shirkawa Daiyoshi had registered their marriage. Some people began to question Chizuru Ueno, believing that her words and deeds were inconsistent.

;

;More than 20 days later, Chizuru Ueno responded by publishing the article "The 15-Hour Bride" in the "Woman Public Theory" magazine to clarify the cause and effect.

;

;Seikawa is 23 years older than Ueno. His wife has passed away and his son has lost contact with her. Ueno has taken on the responsibility of taking care of Seikawa and helping him manage his assets. This relationship is exactly what Ueno wants to study about pension issues in his later years. Through practice, she hopes to establish an effective mutual-help relationship.

;

;However, because Ueno is legally not related to Shikawa, he cannot sign the consent form for the operation at the critical moment, nor can he help him handle complex property matters. He is subject to Japanese family law. In order to facilitate the process, Various problems before and after Sechuan's death forced her to apply for marriage. Their marriage only lasted 15 hours before Sechuan passed away.

;

;"I didn't intend to hide this, but there was no reason to disclose it in the first place. Everyone who knows already knows, and my friends are not the kind to sell their friends' privacy. Villain. But if there are outsiders spreading some false rumors, it would be better for me, the person involved, to tell these stories to everyone personally, so I wrote this article." At the end of the article, Chizuru Ueno wrote.

;

;In September 2023, Chizuru Ueno's new book "Marry Me" was published. In this book, she analyzed in detail her views on issues such as marriage and childbirth. On the cover of this new book, there is this sentence written: "Towards a society where you can freely choose whether to marry, get married, or have children!"

;

;It is no longer impossible to live without marriage

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Can you briefly introduce the background of your writing "Marry Me" and what kind of opportunity it was for you to write it? Have you decided to talk specifically about the issue of being single and not getting married? I'm also curious, has there been any change in Japan's unmarried group since this book was first published? ;

;

;;Chizuru Ueno:;;Among the female population of the same age, I belong to the less than 5% of unmarried people. Japan's lifelong non-marriage rate has continued to rise. By 2020, the non-marriage rate for men was 28.25% and for women was 18.81%. The government calls this statistic "never-married." But I call it "not married". Because "unmarried" means "not yet married", implying that "sooner or later you will get married." However, since there are so many people who are not married, it means that "not getting married" is not a stage of life, but a way of life. ;

;

;Whether you get married or not, you have children, you don’t have children, you get divorced... There are more choices, which is a good thing. Rather than saying that this book had an impact on society, it is better to say that changes in society created needs that prompted the publication of this book. Because before this, those unmarried men and women have always suffered discrimination and were always asked "Why don't you get married?" This book aims to encourage those unmarried people to live an upright life, so I chose "Not Married, Again" how? "(Editor's note: the original title of the Japanese version of "Marry Me") is the title of the book.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;The marriage rate in Japan is also getting lower and lower. Do you think that behind the scenes? What is the reason? Are there different reasons why men choose not to marry and why women choose not to marry? If this continues, people's understanding of marriage will inevitably change. Do you think we have reached such a point now? ;

;

;;Chizuru Ueno:;;Not only because marriage is no longer an attractive option, but also because I want to start a family. The cost is simply too high. That's why the number of men and women who don't get married will increase. Men and women show an asymmetry in their reasons for choosing not to marry. Men cannot get married, and women do not want to get married. In the past, marriage was a necessity of life for both men and women, and it was impossible to live without marriage. But in today's Japan, marriage is a "life surplus asset" that makes life richer. People's expectations for their spouses have also increased a lot compared to the past. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;You once said, "Compared to not getting married, I I want to know more about the reasons for getting married." How do you understand women who enter into marriage? ;

;

;;Chizuru Ueno:;;Having sex because we are in love, having children and becoming parents out of our own will, this experience can make us Life is more abundant. However, many men and women get married and have children when they reach a certain age just for reasons such as obeying traditional customs, "because of parents' requirements", "because of society's requirements". If they have never seen their parents have a happy married life, how can their children be motivated to get married? ;

;

;If women had more choices, they would not choose to marry against their will. And if their married life is very unhappy, they can also escape from it. For this reason, men must make changes.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;You were also exposed to marriage rumors a while ago, until you later made a statement State the cause and effect of the matter. What impact did this have on you? ;

;

;;Chizuru Ueno:;;I am still opposed to the (Japanese) marriage system. Unfortunately, the barriers to Japanese familialism laws are too thick, so I had no choice but to take advantage of the system to do something. To this day, I still deeply regret it. ;

;

;Marriage will not greatly change a woman’s life, but childbirth will

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;When discussing marriage issues, we must also face the issue of fertility. Marriage and childbirth are no longer a must-choose issue in life, but it does not mean that women will no longer be anxious about it. What do you think of this issue? ;

;

;;Chizuru Ueno:;;There is no inevitable relationship between marriage and childbirth. However, many people get married for the purpose of having children. Marriage itself will not bring about any major changes in women's lives, but childbirth will greatly change women's lives. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;"Marriage by Me" also discusses unmarried childbirth , compared with the fertility and parenting issues within marriage, what do you think is special about fertility issues outside marriage? In China, some cities have begun to provide policy support for unmarried mothers such as settlement. There is a sentence on the cover of the Chinese version of "Marry Me": "Towards a society where you can freely choose not to marry, to get married, or to have children!" Is this kind of social form possible? What efforts do people need to make? ;

;

;;Chizuru Ueno:;;Many unmarried single mothers mostly do not actively choose not to get married, but after learning the news of pregnancy, they make themselves The pregnant man ran away. However, they did not choose to induce labor, but chose to give birth to the child. The background condition is that he has the support of his parents in his hometown. Of course, there are also some women who actively choose to become unmarried single mothers because they have certain financial strength. ;

;

;The demand of the Japanese women's movement is to "establish a society where women can give birth and raise children alone." However, society still does not provide enough support to single mothers, and even assigns "three, six, or nine" categories to widowed single mothers, divorced single mothers, and unmarried single mothers. Only recently has discrimination between these categories been gradually erased.

;

;Some people believe that policies to support single mothers will encourage men's "irresponsible" mentality. There is indeed a problem at this level, but the government allocating a certain amount of tax money to support single mothers means that our society has a collective responsibility in raising the next generation, and this collective also includes men who pay more taxes. Some Nordic countries will impose mandatory alimony on the man who got the woman pregnant. If the man is unwilling to pay, the state will advance the payment for him and then hold the man accountable. Japan does not have such a system, which is really a headache.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;For many women who are married and have children, they have to work, You have to take on housework; but if you don’t work, you can’t gain so-called “independence.” This seems to be a dilemma of modernity? Do you think there is a solution to this dilemma? ;

;

;;Chizuru Ueno:;;There are four ways to share women’s family responsibilities: First, the first point is that men should also assume the same family responsibilities; the second point is that the state should provide public childcare services (such as providing nurseries, etc.) to reduce the childcare burden of citizens; the third point is to use the income earned by both parties from working together to hire someone to do housework; the fourth point is, Relying on the power of (maternal) grandmothers, but this approach simply shifts the responsibility from one generation of women to another. ;

;

;In Japan, none of the above four methods exist. This is exactly why Japanese women are in so much pain.

;

;Human beings are fragile

;

;;Southern Weekend:;; Your research not only focuses on history, but also radiates to the present, including but not limited to issues such as sexual violence in war, individual sex and love, the situation of housewives, and care for the elderly. I am very curious about the source of your awareness of these issues. ;

;

;;Chizuru Ueno:;;All my research is based on my own experience. When I was young, I was interested in topics such as "sex" and "love". As I got older, I began to care about topics such as "old age" and "caregiving". I also met and talked to many women who were leading different lives. I have experience living in Germany. Both Japan and Germany were defeated countries in World War II, but what kind of relationships did they establish with their surrounding countries after the war? I was struck by the obvious difference between Germany and Japan on this point. To this day, Japan still has not been able to establish full trusting relations with neighboring countries such as South Korea and China, which it has invaded before. For this reason, I feel very sorry. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Whether it is women or the elderly, the support for the weak Attention is a focus of your research. What do you think you have always adhered to in your entire research context? ;

;

;;Chizuru Ueno:;;I have dealt with many people, and I have deeply understood the truth that human beings are fragile. . Since it is fragile, it should be treated with caution. By thinking this way, we can be tolerant of others and more tolerant of ourselves. This is also the effect of increasing age. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Japan is an aging society, and now in China This question is becoming increasingly important. What are your predictions for the aging East Asian society? What challenges will the elderly face? Now that you yourself have entered the stage of old age, do you have any new understanding of life? ;

;

;;Chizuru Ueno:;;Countries in East Asia are rapidly entering an aging society, and Japan is a developed country with an aging society, so it should be able to use it Just for reference. The long-term care insurance introduced by Japan more than 20 years ago has played a great role in allowing citizens to live with peace of mind in old age. Hopefully we can learn something from it too. For me, growing older is a new experience. If what needs to be protected disappears and there is nothing left to lose, the person will become increasingly free. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;You emphasized in the documentary "The Last Lesson" "Feminism is about enabling the weak to survive as the weak", which reverses many people's misunderstanding that feminism only focuses on "women" issues. Why does feminism naturally care for and affirm the weak? ;

;

;;Chizuru Ueno:;;No matter how powerful a person is, he is also weak at birth. And one day he will definitely become a weakling. Men are no exception. Women often accompany children, the elderly, the disabled and the sick, so they understand the weak and can imagine their plight. And men just forget these, or just pretend to forget. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;You emphasize that this is no longer a matter of hard work. A rewarding society, while emphasizing care for the "weak", once said, "Please don't show off your strength, but admit your weaknesses and support each other to live." Can it be understood that people need to build some kind of community and help each other make society a better place? ;

;

;;Chizuru Ueno:;;People cannot live alone in the world, and they cannot die alone when they die. Building a community that supports each other to survive is an important matter for everyone, regardless of gender. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;You are considered to be Japan's No. 1 "women's studies" One person, forty years ago, when you established Women’s Studies in Japan, what was the status of women in Japan at that time? After so many years of development, what achievements has Japan’s “women’s studies” research made today? ;

;

;;Chizuru Ueno:;;Forty years ago, there was no such subject for women in Japanese universities. So we, the pioneer generation, learned women’s studies on our own. At that time, some people still ridiculed us, "Is women's studies a science?" Later, women's studies entered all professional fields and was established as a discipline, and relevant courses were also offered in universities. It is a pity that Japanese universities have neither “women’s studies departments” nor “women’s studies directions.” Rather than enclosing territory, it is more important to extend gender perspectives across all fields. As a result, we have accumulated theoretical and empirical research on women’s studies and gender studies in many fields, and have trained many researchers. The website "WAN" (https://wan.or.jp/general/corner/papers) we created has collected a list of more than 1,500 dissertations on women's studies or gender studies over more than 40 years. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;There is a concept that when it comes to feminism, It seems that it is inevitable to discuss love, marriage and family, and some of your research is also related to this, but is this what feminism is all about? ;

;

;;Chizuru Ueno:;;No, it’s because in human society, no group is independent of gender. So when there are women, we use women’s experience as the research object. When there are no women, we study why there are no women. When focusing on men, we study how this characteristic of men is shaped. Therefore, there is no field that gender studies cannot deal with. ;

;

;"Criticism" and "blame" are different

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;"Marry Me" is a collection of dialogues, and in addition to your serious academic works, you also often have dialogues with people from all walks of life. For example, your previous "Starting at the Limit" caused a lot of discussion in China. What do you think the dialogue means to you? By communicating with people from different generations and backgrounds, what do you want to convey to your readers? ;

;

;;Chizuru Ueno:;;I really like talking to people with different life backgrounds. This can stimulate my curiosity, and during the conversation Sometimes the other person will bring out another side of me that I have never noticed. "Others" are an important catalyst for me to know who I really am. Similarly, when readers read a book in the form of a dialogue, I also hope that they can participate in the dialogue and enjoy the joy and joy of "discovering who they are." ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;As an academic scholar, you actively Have you ever been questioned because of your involvement in social affairs and your promotion of feminism? Your speech at the opening ceremony of the University of Tokyo in 2019 also had a great response in China. Your speech at the time was very sharp and your criticism of the school was very direct. Why did you deliver such a speech at that time? ;

;

;;Chizuru Ueno:;;The University of Tokyo invited me to attend the entrance ceremony as a guest. Although they asked me to submit the original manuscript of my speech, they did not interfere with the speech at all. content of the manuscript. The content of my speech was all planned out in advance. Because the podium at the entrance ceremony also has a "speaker" effect, I think this is a good opportunity to convey what I have been thinking to a larger audience. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;After your speech at the University of Tokyo, you became an internet celebrity. "Celebrity" has attracted the attention of intellectual circles in China. Especially in recent years, a large number of your books have been published in China. What do you think of this phenomenon? Why do you think Chinese readers, especially female readers, admire you so much? Do you think it is a good thing that intellectuals have become "popular" due to the Internet? ;

;

;;Chizuru Ueno:;;The goal of feminism is to verbalize and theorize women’s experience. I think it is because the younger generation of women in China have found the language to express their own experiences in my works. One thing that Japan and China have in common is that many girls are carefully raised in a generation with a low birthrate. Under China's reform and opening up policy, and with the continuous development of marketization, the life experiences of women in the two countries may be getting closer and closer. Moreover, Chinese readers may feel closer to Asian feminism than to feminism in Europe and America. However, I am very much looking forward to seeing the emergence of Chinese-specific feminology and the birth of Chinese feminism. ;

;

;I don’t think there is anything to worry about when intellectuals become popular people. People who write books naturally hope that more readers will read their works. However, it is a bit distressing to praise or condemn on the Internet without even reading it.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;One ​​view is that the status of women in East Asia is compared to that in Europe and the United States. The situation is not ideal. What do you think is the underlying reason? In 2019, you visited and gave lectures in many cities in China. What impression did you leave on Chinese women? ;

;

;;Chizuru Ueno:;;Although they are both East Asian countries, the situations of women in China, Japan, and South Korea are different. Every country has its own unique circumstances. It needs to be studied separately for different societies. Although I have come to Chinese universities to give lectures, I have only met (mostly) elite women from cities who attend mindful universities, and I know nothing about women living in the vast rural areas, so I cannot answer this question. I think this issue needs to be studied by Chinese researchers. My impression of the elite women living in the city is that they are girls who were carefully raised as only children. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;You have encountered many doubts along the way. How did you respond? Generally speaking, East Asians value "politeness", but is "quarrel" an effective means for women to fight against injustice? ;

;

;;Chizuru Ueno:;;An argument is not a "quarrel". I did not take up my position at the University of Tokyo to "teach quarrels." All kinds of knowledge develop from "dissent". Women's studies and gender studies are not afraid of controversy, and to this day and ever since, it has been a field of scholarship that has been hotly debated and thus advanced. "Criticism" is different from "blame". When facing an object that needs criticism, it is important to present our arguments and criticize the opponent logically and rigorously. I believe that academics are a weapon for the weak. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;How do you feel about your personal influence on social media? various controversies? ;

;

;;Chizuru Ueno:;;On social networks, attacks and arguments will be amplified. It is not a place for fair discussion. The world of social networks is not everything, and it’s important to keep your distance from it. ;

;"Long white ginseng, urala grass, white mountain black water are all treasures! Siberian tiger, sika deer, roe deer, black bear and wild boar!" ;The above scene is from an article called "To promote Northeastern idols, of course you have to use Northeastern dialect to promote them!" ! The video of Changchun underground idol Blossom's first performance of "Geqie" has been viewed more than 5 million times on station B. In May of this year, the popularity of the video made the term "We also have underground idols in the Northeast" a hot search topic. This was also the first time that the niche culture of "underground idols" appeared on mainstream domestic social platforms.

;

;What is an "underground idol"? It originated in Japan and specifically refers to artists or groups that focus on offline performances, usually do not appear on mainstream media such as TV, and have not debuted through a brokerage company. In 2023, with the full resumption of offline performances, "ground puppets" (short for "underground idols") have gradually entered the lives of young people. More and more fans who love idol groups and singing and dancing performances choose to go to large and small shopping malls, theaters, and live houses on weekends to cheer for their favorite idols.

;

;At the same time, the "underground idol" industry is quietly emerging and expanding rapidly in China. According to statistics from the @Underground Idol related bulletin board, there are currently about 131 underground idol groups active in China, distributed in 22 provinces, municipalities and special administrative regions across the country, especially in first-tier cities such as Beijing, Shanghai and Guangzhou (12 in Beijing , Shanghai 21). More than a year ago, in September 2022, the total number of domestic "geido" groups was only about 53. In other words, about half of the "Geo Puppet" groups currently active were formed this year. Because of this, 2023 is also called the "First Year of Ge Puppet".

;

;What unique charm does “underground idol” have? Why did it attract so many fans and rise so quickly this year? How is it different from the traditional idol industry? As an imported culture, what challenges does its localization development in China face? Focusing on these questions, our reporters recently visited relevant fans, operators and new underground idols to help everyone learn more about the slightly new concept of "ground puppets".

;

;;;

;;What is an “underground idol”? ;

;

;;All open-mic singing and dancing on the stage, immersive interaction off the stage, and "special talks" at close range;

;

;This year One weekend in the spring, Xiao Zhang (pseudonym) went to watch an "underground idol" offline performance for the first time, and from then on, he "entered the trap" and started chasing "underground idols". Before that, she had only heard of the term "underground idol". By chance, she saw the activity information of "Geo Puppet" on social platforms and learned that its performance included Japanese songs that she usually liked to listen to. She became interested and went to the venue with her friends.

;

;“Very energetic, full of real singing, and highly infectious.” This is Xiaozhang’s biggest feeling after watching the performance of “Earth Puppet” for the first time. "I feel very happy!" Xiao Zhang felt the sincerity and hard work of the performers, and at the same time, she became a fan of one of the young idols. "I feel that her style is more special and eye-catching." She recalled.

;

;In addition, Xiao Zhang was deeply impressed by the way the audience supported him that day: "A group of people would pick up an audience member and rush from the back of the auditorium to the front of the stage to interact with the little idol." The enthusiastic support scene shocked him deeply.

;

;The high degree of interaction and various interesting ways of supporting have also become a unique charm of underground idol performances, making the audience and fans feel that they are an indispensable part of the performance. Another "Diido" fan Xiaojie (pseudonym) told reporters: "Underground idols make people feel more involved, or closer (to the idols) and more interactive (with the idols). They There are many people dancing on the stage and off the stage, and the atmosphere is even better."

;

;;

;

;Of course, there are also noisy "social cows" groups among the audience of "Land Puppet". Xiao Zhang mentioned that the organizer of that performance set up zones for the audience, including "quiet viewing area", "free area" and "female area".

;

;In the "Free Zone", fans will support and interact enthusiastically, such as the "take-off" mentioned just now - lifting the audience up and "flying" to the stage; "Quiet Viewing Zone" " is prepared for the introverted "i people" group. They don't need to do anything, and just want to enjoy the idol's performance silently in the audience. Xiao Zhang chose to stay in the "female area", and this part of the audience will wave light sticks in honor of their idols. Calling, but not nearly as intense as "Free Zone". The setting of partitioned viewing ensures that audiences with different personalities can be immersed in the performance and avoid mutual interference and collision.

;

;After the performance, Xiao Zhang had his first photo with his idol at the following "special event". "Special Bonus" is an event held together with the performances of underground idol groups. Fans can purchase idol-related peripheral products at the "Special Bonus" and purchase "Special Vouchers" to take photos and communicate with their idols up close. Chance.

;

;;;

;Xiaozhang told reporters that the organizers of underground idol performances regularly invite various underground idol groups to perform assorted performances. The ticket prices for the performances range from tens to 200 yuan depending on the size of the event (occasionally there are free performances) , the box office revenue belongs to the show organizer. The income of idol group companies and members mainly depends on fans' consumption at "special events".

;

;She told reporters that fans of "Geo Doll" call taking Polaroid photos with their idols "Paikiri" (translated from the Japanese transliteration of Polaroid), and idols will also "cut" Leave your own signature graffiti on (photo). The average price of a "che" with an idol's signature graffiti is about 80-100 yuan; the average price of a "che" without a signature graffiti is about 40-60 yuan.

;

;Purchasing a "special coupon" will not only give you the opportunity to take a Polaroid photo with your idol, but also means that fans will have the opportunity to chat with their idol up close for about a minute, so the special coupon will be Also known as "Qiaochanghui" (shooting + chatting). Xiaozhang told reporters that while fans are communicating with their idols, there will be staff standing by to count the time. Many fans will buy a dozen or even dozens of special coupons at one time in order to gain more time with their idols.

;

;;Why do we need “underground idols”? ;

;

;;Emotional value, high cost performance, two-way travel;

;

;When talking about the reasons for "falling into the trap", Xiaozhang emphasized that "all The importance of "real singing" and "stage appeal".

;

;Before, she also went to watch offline performances of some "above ground" idol groups (contrary to "underground", idol artists who will be exposed in mainstream media). In order to ensure the quality of the performance, the audience rarely gets to see the full stage of singing and dancing. "In comparison, 'Dippo' has better stage appeal, and singing on the mic is really important."

;

;;

;

;Through the stage of underground idols, Xiao Zhang can feel that these young idols are coming from their own hearts. I love singing and dancing at heart. "Seeing this person working hard for his beloved dream and shining on the stage makes me feel inspired." Perhaps many people have had an "idol dream" in their hearts, but they were unable to realize it due to various reasons. "Seeing them When you work hard, you feel good, and you feel that you have to work harder (to live a good life)."

;

;Although the singing and dancing levels of underground idols vary, some members have made great progress. There is no space, but in the eyes of fans such as Xiao Zhang, daring to open the microphone and sing for real is an attitude worthy of recognition, "At least they work hard to show themselves on stage. And I think she (Xiao Zhang's idol) has the talent to sing." Progress can be clearly felt."

;

;In an interview with reporters, fan Xiaojie attributed the essence of chasing stars to "obtaining emotional value": "The purpose of chasing idols is not to say that our aesthetics have How high it is depends on how strong their singing and dancing skills are. They are just chasing an emotional value. Watching idols will make our lives more interesting and make every weekend more fulfilling. When we are so tired from work, we have to think of something to support us. Go down."

;

;;

;

;In the conversation with reporters, the two fans unanimously mentioned that compared to those mainstream idols who are active in the public eye, chasing "land idols" has a higher cost-effectiveness and allows them to be in the public eye. Get more emotional value with the same effort.

;

;For example, the "above ground" idol group SNH48 also uses "face-to-face idols" as its operating model, with theater performances and "handshake meetings" similar to "special parties", but its prices are much higher than those of the "ground" idol group. I". Ticket prices, originally priced at only 98 yuan, have been skyrocketed, and tickets for popular events cost tens to hundreds of yuan. If you want a VIP position such as the first row, you need to bid, which can easily cost thousands of yuan. A handshake ticket (which allows you to shake hands and chat with a young idol for 10 seconds) costs 20 to 30 yuan, an autograph ticket costs 100 to 200 yuan, and a photo ticket costs 600 to 700 yuan.

;

;Obviously, when "Geo Puppet" provides services such as photos, autographs, and face-to-face communication, fans can gain a richer emotional experience at less cost. After all, the number of fans that "ground puppets" have is far less than that of celebrity artists. Most of them have clear impressions of their followers. They will remember almost every fan's appearance, preferences, topics of communication and other details. There are also many more. Respond with energy and emotion to achieve a true "two-way rush".

;

;;;

;Xiaojie shared with reporters that she once received a fan benefit when she purchased a certain number of "special coupons" - asking her idol to write a letter to her. "Because I wrote her a letter before, she wrote a reply." In that letter to her idol, Xiaojie mentioned how happy she felt every time she went to watch her idol's performance, and these contents It was also mentioned one by one by the idol in the reply letter, "She told me (written in the reply letter) that actually when she received my letter, she was very unsure and confused. She said it was mine. That letter gave her a lot of strength."

;

;In addition, the idol also expressed her persistence and love for this career and her years of pursuing her dream. "She said that every time she stood on the stage Every time she went on stage, she would feel a sense of tingling excitement. She had very few fans before, and she thought about whether to continue, and was confused for a long time... But in the end she figured it out, as long as she enjoys standing on the stage It’ll be great when you get on.”

;

;Xiaojie mentioned that compared to mainstream celebrity artists, the feeling of “Chasing the Earth Puppet” is more pure. Since underground idols are not exposed in the media, the state of being close to amateurs will be more real and relaxed. Without the constraints of the company, the packaging of personality, and the scrutiny of the public, fans can feel "the intimacy like friends" when communicating with idols. .

;

;;Who is becoming an “underground idol”? ;

;

;;Liu Xiajun: "After becoming an underground idol, I clearly know who is supporting me.";

;

;Have participated in "Creation" Liu Hajun, the singing and dancing idol of "Camp 2019", experienced "from the ground to the underground" this year and became the captain of the men's "ground puppet" group "Brick Paw Team", thus having the opportunity to go on stage again and have close contact with fans. Opportunity.

;

;;;

;Liu Xiajun (middle)

;

;Liu Xiajun told reporters that since "Produce Camp 2019", he has rarely been on stage again Opportunity to sing and dance on stage. At first, he was an artist of his former company doing various interviews and filming work. Later, due to the epidemic, the company was disbanded and reorganized, and his work content became live broadcasting.

;

;But soon, he was not used to live broadcasts and realized that what he really wanted to do was sing and dance on stage, so he terminated his contract with the company and once again turned his identity into a dance troupe member and dance teacher.

;

;At the beginning of this year, a friend of Liu Xiajun learned that a men's "ground puppet" group was recruiting members, and immediately recommended Liu Xiajun to sign up. "He said that when he saw the registration requirements, he felt that it was tailor-made for me - 'good at singing and dancing, and loves the stage.'"

;

;From this, Liu Xiajun began to gradually understand the "ground puppets" "This profession. "The most attractive thing about this thing is that I can go on stage." After searching for information and watching offline, his love and yearning for the stage defeated all hesitations and concerns, and he finally decided to give it a try.

;

;Since then, Liu Xiajun has become the captain of the first men's "ground puppet" group in China, the "Brick-moving Barking Team". The group has a total of six members, including students and 9-to-5 workers.

;

;Liu Xiajun revealed that the team's rehearsal time is usually set after nine o'clock in the evening, and everyone works hard to get along with each other. "As for the stage, I still demand myself according to the requirements of the past (during the Creation Camp), even better than before."

;

;On May 27, the "Brick-Moving Wangwang Team" successfully ushered in First performance. Liu Xiajun still clearly remembers that many fans who have liked him since the broadcast of "Produce Camp 2019" came to the scene to support him, which moved him very much: "Many fans from 4 years ago still support me now. , has been with me for a long time. At that moment, I really felt that I did the right thing and did not let them down."

;

;As a former "above ground idol", in the process of turning to the "underground" , Liu Xiajun is also slowly adapting to his new identity and constantly learning new skills, such as how to communicate closely with fans at the "special party" after the performance, what topics should he talk to everyone; when there are fans How to communicate with them when talking about life troubles; what patterns should be drawn when signing and graffiti on "Che" (photos)...

;

;;

;

;In addition, in Liu Xiajun's view, being a "land puppet" is more unique The advantage is that he can receive more intuitive, specific and immediate feedback from fans. The relationship between idols and fans has changed from one-way output to two-way interaction.

;

;"When I participated in "Creation Camp", I knew that some people liked me, but 'fans' were more like a concept with a certain sense of distance. But when I was an underground idol, I was able to I know very clearly who is supporting me, her nickname, image, and even her emotions and her story. I can know why everyone likes me and what is not good about my performance today."

;

;When asked "What kind of person is suitable to be a puppet", Liu Xiajun also mentioned the word "emotional value".

;

;"I think to be an underground idol, you must be a very sincere person. You must love this job, respect this job, and sincerely face all the people who support you. Your singing and dancing skills can continue Growth, but attitude is the most important." He talked about his understanding of the profession of "idol", "The duty of an idol is to make fans happy, to bring good energy to fans, (to provide them with) 'emotional value' 'For an idol, it is greater than anything else."

;

;;What is the future of "underground idols"? ;

;

;;Conversation with performance operators & group producers;

;

;In addition to artists with stage experience like Liu Xiajun, there are also a large number of people who love singing Amateur stage dancers have joined the "ground puppet" industry in recent years. However, it should be noted that as a new industry, underground idols have not yet reached a mature stage. Many relevant reports have mentioned that the income of most underground idols is not considerable, and most of them work part-time to "generate money for love."

;

;Liu Xiajun revealed to reporters that he never regarded "ground puppets" as a way to make money from the beginning. "In fact (now) most of his income still comes from being a dance teacher and performing in a dance troupe. Underground The job of an idol is more out of love."

;

;Liu Xiajun, who has a certain fan base, cannot support himself just by being a "land puppet", let alone those who need to accumulate popularity from scratch. Amateur idol. Although more and more people are joining in, with the current audience size, "ground puppet" has not yet developed into a stable career that can make a living.

;

;Xiao Liu (pseudonym), who started hosting "ground puppet" performances in 2021, told reporters that he has always treated the "ground puppet" group as real commercial entertainers. If they are invited to participate in the platter, If they perform, their travel expenses will be reimbursed to ensure that the groups that come to perform do not lose money.

;

; "We will share some of the commission for the 'special event', but we will ensure that you will have a certain amount of income as long as you come." Xiao Liu revealed that this method of operation is different from most situations in the industry. "Other performances The organizers basically ask you to bear the performance costs yourself, but basically most people (the income from the special events) cannot afford their own travel expenses, so it is easy to lose money as a group, and it will also cause a very high income (for the puppets). Unstable."

;

;;

;

;What is more worrying than the meager income is the chaos in the industry.

;

;Starting this year, in addition to hosting platter performances, Xiao Liu has also begun to create and operate a new "ground puppet" group. Talking about his original intention to join a group, Xiao Liu mentioned that he has seen some bad phenomena in the industry in recent years and hopes to do his best to improve the current situation.

;

;“We feel that there are many children, who may be minors or just adults, as well as freshly graduated college students. They are completely unaware of the sinister side of society and will be deceived and work for others for nothing. The share received is very small." Xiao Liu also revealed that some companies will even pocket the travel subsidies provided by the event organizers, "asking the organizers to reimburse hotel expenses and actually allowing members to stay in youth hostels."

;

;Xiao Liu It is hoped that through the production team, we can find "Earth Puppet" members with real potential, and at the same time, we can provide them with relatively better treatment and protect their living foundation. "We will reimburse them for all travel expenses for performances, including daily rehearsals, costumes, songwriting, etc., all of which will be borne by us, and the income share we give them will be higher than the general level in the industry." Xiao Liu told reporters, At present, in addition to "land puppets", he is also engaged in other businesses, and the related income also supports him to continue to be an underground idol. "Because we are not making money from this (land puppets), so as long as we don't pay particularly hard, , we can do it.”

;

;As an imported culture, underground idols still face the test of localization.

;

;Fan Zhang mentioned in an interview that the current performances of many "ground puppet" groups are still mainly covering songs of Japanese underground idols. Even if they are original songs, many of them are in Japanese. . "There are definitely copyright issues (for performance covers), but it may be because it is difficult for (foreign copyright holders) to come to China to trace back." Xiao Liu told reporters that his group is also preparing original songs with Chinese lyrics to enrich the performance. content.

;

;In addition to the localization of performance content, the "ground puppet" industry still faces many problems in its rapid development and expansion, such as the diversification of audiences. Xiao Liu mentioned in an interview that a large part of the current domestic audience for "geol" people have "climbed over the wall" from other cultural circles. Their aesthetic orientations and star-chasing habits are diverse. What should we do? Compatible coexistence?

;

;For another example, he knows that this industry needs relevant treaties to regulate it, but he also bluntly said: "It itself is an 'underground culture'. If there is too much intervention in the 'above ground' way, there may be no It’s the kind of freedom that everyone loves.”

;

;While many fans like Xiaozhang "hope that more people can understand and accept this niche culture", many people also raise questions and concerns about promoting "Earth Puppets" out of the circle. , to some extent it seems to be contrary to the essence of "Earth Puppet"...

;

;Although everything is still being explored, we need to gradually improve it to achieve a certain balance. But what is worthy of recognition is that the "underground idols" that are growing freely and expanding rapidly have provided a new opportunity and possibility for the idol industry that has been in the cold at the moment when domestic entertainment talent shows are suspended.

;

;It allows us to see that "star chasing" is not only fans' admiration and following of idols, and the construction and imagination of intimate relationships, but also two-way, equal, and co-creation. Clear business rules and a close interactive experience allow idols who enjoy the stage to see clearly the faces of everyone in the audience, allowing fans to receive real and concrete responses to their efforts. In the world of "underground idols", "going both ways" is easier to cash in on.
